alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 2:35PM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Forecast...With additional heavy rain in the forecast, the river will rise to 28.1 feet late tonight. It will then fall temporarily and begin rising again early Friday afternoon to near 28.7 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 27.5 Thu 1 PM 27.9 28.7 27.8 28.1 1 AM 6/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
